results.title: Camelot
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Jack L. Warner and Joshua Logan
results.brief_description: Adapted from the very successful Broadway show, “Camelot” features songs from the renowned songwriting team of Lerner and Loewe. Starring Richard Harris, Vanessa Redgrave, Franco Nero, David Hemmings and Lionel Jeffries, it tells of the tragic romantic triangle between Arthur, Guinevere and Sir Lancelot.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Warner Bros Pictures, Jack L. Warner and Joshua Logan

results.title: Came a hot friday
results.creator_credit: Mirage Films, Challenge Film Corporation, Larry Parr and Ian Mune
results.brief_description: It is 1949. The privations of war are over and there is money to be made! Two conmen have been successfully cheating bookies at racetracks across the United States. When they stop at a small town called Tainuia Junction, their luck runs out. After waging a war with the local police and the owner of the town casino, they enlist the aid of the Tainuia Kid, a Zorro nut and the wildest comic ever to ride the ranges. It is the bad guys versus the not-so-bad guys in this off-the-wall comedy that takes the viewer on a rollercoaster of laughs against a backdrop of horseracing, gambling, fast cars and loose women. Starring Billy T. James, Peter Bland, Phillip Gordon and Marshall Napier. Based on the novel by Ronald Hugh Morrieson.

results.title: Call of the wild
results.creator_credit: Massfilms, CCC Filmkunst, Izaro Films, Oceania Produzioni Internazionali Cinematografiche, Universal Pictures France, Towers of London (Films), Harry Allen Towers, Arthur Brauner and Ken Annakin
results.brief_description: One of a plethora of adaptations for the big and small screen of Jack London’s famous novel, this 1972 film version of “Call of the wild” features Charlton Heston as Jack Thornton, a kindly would-be prospector heading for the 1897 Klondike gold rush, who adopts a mistreated dog. The man and the animal strike up a unique friendship as they travel through the wilderness. This family orientated film was a multi-national production filmed on location in Norway. The voices of non-English speaking actors were dubbed into English. Cast also includes Michele Mercier, George Eastman and Maria Rohm.

results.title: California suite
results.creator_credit: Columbia Films, Ray Stark and Herbert Ross
results.brief_description: Five couples find themselves in a Beverley Hills hotel during the week of the Oscars. Four stories blend with an all star cast and the slick writing style of Neil Simon, to produce a comedy about human behaviour in all its variety. Maggie Smith won the Oscar for this 1970’s comedy which made the transition from the New York Stage to the big screen. Also stars: Jane Fonda, Alan Alda, Michael Caine, Walter Matthau, Elaine May, Herb Edelman, Denise Galik, Richard Pryor, Bill Cosby, Gloria Gifford and Sheila Frazier.

results.title: Calamity Jane (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, William Jacobs and David Butler
results.brief_description: The Wild West in a spectacular musical with Doris Day as Calamity Jane and Howard Keel as Wild Bill Hickcock. Calamity Jane arrives from the “Windy city” after finding a star attraction for the local saloon. As she is taken by the “Deadwood Stage” to the “Black hills of Dakota”, she meets Wild Bill Hickock, her “Secret love”.

results.title: Cairo station = Bab el hadid
results.brief_description: Renowned Egyptian director Youssef Chahine established his international reputation with “Cairo Station” after it screened at the Berlin Film Festival. Focusing on a group of marginalised luggage carriers and soft-drink sellers who live in abandoned traincars, Chahine posits Cairo’s main railroad station as a microcosm of Egyptian society. A crippled newspaper dealer (played powerfully by Chahine himself), falls in love with a beautiful but indifferent lemonade seller who is engaged to the muscular and virile leader of the luggage-carriers. Swept away by his obsessive desire, the crippled man kidnaps the object of his passion, with terrible consequences. Into this story of doomed sexual obsession amongst a shadowy underclass, Chahine weaves glaring economic disparity, union activity, and other politically charged motifs. The work of Fritz Lang and the genres of film-noir and neo-realism are often cited as influences on the film. In Arabic with English subtitles.

results.title: Caddie
results.brief_description: Caddie (Helen Morse) is a young woman who leaves her husband, taking the children with her. The film traces her struggle to survive during the depression. Based on a real life anonymous autobiography of a young woman who took a job as a barmaid to support her two children.

results.title: Cabin fever
results.creator_credit: ICON, Black Sky Entertainment, Deer Path Films, Sam Froelich, Evan Astrowsky, Lauren Moews and Eli Roth
results.brief_description: Written, directed and produced by Eli Roth, “Cabin Fever” is about a group of five friends who happily set out for a holiday adventure in a cabin in the woods. All seems fine until one of them gets sick with a gross flesh-eating virus. So scary it’s funny, this gory film is written to graphically shock you as opposed to keeping you in suspense, it even comes with a director’s warning at the beginning! Cast includes Jordan Ladd, James DeBello, Rider Strong, Joey Kern and Cerina Vincent. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: Cabaret
results.creator_credit: ABC Pictures (US), Allied Artists Pictures, Cy Feuer and Bob Fosse
results.brief_description: One of the most acclaimed Broadway musicals of all time is brought to the screen with the aid of the brilliant and electrifying Liza Minnelli. For entertainment as its very best you can’t go past “Cabaret” - a scintillating musical with pure gold of human drama beneath its surface glitter. A one-of-a kind musical. Based on Christopher Isherwood’s Berlin stories.
